subtitle.Text: Steve: So these are... Stereographic? Stereoscopic?
Karla: Stereogram? Steve: Yeah, these are Stereograms.

Steve: Stereograms, popularized by the Magic Eye brand of images from, yeah, the 80s and 90s. These really work, like if you cross your eyes and you can do a Magic Eye image, you can see what's in these.
Karla: Well, as I recall, there's a cool shark.
Steve: And? Karla: I don't remember what the other one is.
Steve: Karla! Karla: What? Steve: It's a big heart.
Karla: OK, it's hard for me to do those things.
Steve: And that's true for a lot of people! So the two instances of people not being able to see those images are, they just can't do them, which a lot of people just can't do them,
OR, they were born in the late 90s or after the 90s, and played our game and didn't know what the hell these things were.
Karla: Yeah, they'd be like "What is this weird static shit?"
Steve: Yeah, we got some messages that were like, "I thought it was just a weird drawing!"
Karla: So good. Steve: So, yes, as you get older, you can't hear really high-pitched sounds any more, and you know what Magic Eyes are, still.
Karla: It's the circle of life.
